citation.article-title: Maribius salinus gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a solar saltern and Maribius pelagius sp. nov., cultured from the Sargasso Sea, belonging to the Roseobacter clade
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Maribius (Ma.ri.bi′us. L. neut. n. mare the sea; N.L. masc. n. bius from Gr. n. bios life; N.L. masc. n. Maribius sea life).
Growth is obligately heterotrophic and strictly aerobic.
On MA medium, colonies are circular, entire, convex, opaque and beige in colour.
Require Mg2+ and Na+ for growth.
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is UQ-10.
Dominant fatty acids are 18 : 1ω7c and cyclo 19 : 0ω8c.
Cells do not contain bacteriochlorophyll a.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA is 66.7–70.0 mol%.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Rhodobacteraceae.
The type species is Maribius salinus.
